subject: Sexual Health
title: Exercise and Pubertal Development
description: A micro-lesson that makes Exercise and Pubertal Development usable.

hook.text: Regular exercise during puberty builds stronger bones, better moods, and healthier hormone balance.

buildup.text: Weight-bearing exercise during puberty maximizes bone mineral density, setting reserves for adulthood.

discovery.text: Exercise boosts endorphins and serotonin, naturally combating the mood swings and anxiety of puberty.

twist.text: Excessive exercise, especially in female athletes, can delay puberty and disrupt menstrual cycles.

climax.text: Moderate, enjoyable physical activity supports every aspect of pubertal development without the risks of extremes.

punchline.text: Move for mood, bones, and balance. Not to extremes.

quiz.question: What can excessive exercise do to puberty in girls?
options: Delay it and disrupt menstrual cycles
